meanings.definition: A sudden feeling of excitement or pleasure
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride gave me a big thrill.
meanings.sent2: The movie ending was a real thrill for the audience.
meanings.sent3: Feeling a thrill when seeing a shooting star is magical.
meanings.sent4: The thrill of winning the race was like fireworks in my heart.
meanings.sent5: The thrill of a surprise party can make memories that last a lifetime.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel excited or pleased
meanings.sent1: Her performance on stage never fails to thrill the audience.
meanings.sent2: The magician's tricks never fail to thrill the children.
meanings.sent3: Watching a puppy play can thrill even the grumpiest person.
meanings.sent4: His words thrilled her heart like a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected gift thrilled him beyond words.

meanings.sent1: The cold wind made the leaves on the trees thrill.
meanings.sent2: The tiny dog began to thrill with excitement when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent3: The earthquake made the ground thrill beneath our feet.
meanings.sent4: Her voice thrilled with emotion as she sang the high notes.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the upcoming event made her heart thrill with nervous energy.
